resources.string: Talkback Tutorial
Lessons
\n
This module covers how to adjust TalkBack\'s reading controls, which lets us make TalkBack read and navigate in different ways. When you change modes, TalkBack will speak the mode you switched to.
To change your mode, swipe up and down in one motion. Try to go through all of the options before moving on.
You can go backwards through the list. Swipe down then up in one motion to go through the list in the opposite direction.
Modes can also be switched by swiping with three fingers horizontally either to the left or to the right. Try going through the list with three finger swipes in both directions before moving on.
That\'s all there is to changing modes. The rest of this lesson covers how to use these modes. Activate the button below to finish this module.
Finish module
The \"Controls\" reading mode allows jumping between buttons, sliders, switches, and other interactive things.
Switch to the %s reading mode and swipe down to jump to the next %s.
You performed the wrong action. Please try again.
This element will push you back

There are reading and navigation modes. Reading modes help you read in a granular way, such as by words, paragraphs, or characters. Navigation modes help you move around more efficiently, such as by jumping from button to button.
Finish Module
Can you can a canned can into an un-canned can like a canner can can a canned can into an un-canned can?
She sells seashells on the seashore. The shells she sells are seashells, I’m sure. And if she sells seashells on the seashore, Then I’m sure she sells seashore shells.
Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers; A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked; If Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers, Where’s the peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked
There\'s another %s below. Jump to it.
This is the last %s. Activate it to continue.
To continue, swipe up to the previous %s
That\'s the basics of jumping between %s. Activate to %s.
header
headers
control
controls
link
links
continue
finish module
The \"Headers\" reading mode allows you to jump between headers, such those found before blocks of text or groups of form fields.
The \"Links\" navigation mode lets you jump between clickable links on a page, such as a URL.
We will now learn to use each reading modes. As you have learned previously, please switch to the reading mode that says \"Paragraph\"

You will now learn to transition between paragraphs. A single swipe up or down will transition between different paragraphs that are on the screen. Please try it until you reach a button that says finish lesson, then double tap to finish the lesson. For your information, this will be a very long practice text so it would be easier to complete it using the Paragraph reading mode. However, you can still try out different reading modes such as Characters, Words and lines reading modes.

You have completed the lesson. To summarise, in this lesson you have learnt to use the Paragraph reading mode to navigate through the page. In the future, you can utilise these different reading modes such as Headers, Controls, Links and more, to navigate through your phone. Sending you back to the Lesson modules.
If you have changed reading mode to Paragraph mode, Please double tap to continue
Input

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to return to the home screen from inside an application, to perform this task, swipe up then left. Try it now. But return to the tutorial after you have reached the home screen.
Good, you are back, this gesture is useful as it allows you to return to the home screen at anytime no matter where you are. Now do it again, remember the gesture is swipe up then left
Nice, you have navigated back to this screen, you have now learnt how to use the go to home screen gesture. Returning you to the lesson screen now.

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open your notification panel. Notifications are a way to let you know that something new has happened so you do not miss anything that might be worth your attention and appears whether you are using the application or not. There are two way to do this. First, let us open the notification panel by putting 2 finger on top of the screen then swipe down. Once you opened the notification panel, Talkback will start taking over for a few second. Please wait until Talkback is done then follow the next instruction. Good luck.
Good job. You have opened the notification panel. Now try to close it by doing the same gesture but this time start from the bottom to top"
Well done. The notification panel has been closed. Let\'s try to open it one more time but this time, open it by swiping right, then down immediately.
Excellent. Now close it again by swiping from the bottom with 2 fingers

Well done! You now know how to open and check and close your notification panel. Notification panel can also be used to perform many kind of shortcut. For example, connect or disconnect wifi or bluetooth. You have completed the lesson. We will send you back.

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open recent apps. Recent apps are a handy way to quickly switch between frequently used apps. This can be done in two different ways. Firstly, perform a swipe left and then, a swipe up gesture. Please try to perform these gestures one after another, and enter the recent apps menu. Once completed, return to the tutorial.
Great job. You have correctly opened the recent app menu and returned to the tutorial. Now to try with a different method.
Try to open the recent apps menu by double tapping the recents button in the bottom right or bottom left corner of your phone. Once again, open the recent apps menu and then return to the tutorial.
You have completed the open recent apps module. Sending you to the lesson screen.
Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to enable voice commands. To enable voice commands you need to swipe right and then up.
You have completed this module

In this module, you will learn how to add a space using the braille keyboard. Ensure the braille keyboard is active and set to default. If you are unsure how to do this, refer to a previous module. To begin, type the letter a in braille and then submit the text. To submit, use a two finger swipe up gesture. Note, the braille keyboard must be in the correct orientation for this gesture to work correctly.
Incorrect letter submitted. Try again.
Great job. You correctly typed in a space.
Now, try to shift to a new line and submit using the same two finger swipe up gesture.
Great job. You correctly moved to a new line. You have completed this module. Sending you back to the lesson screen.
Incorrect input submitted. Try again.

In this module, you will learn how to submit text using the braille keyboard. Ensure the braille keyboard is active and set to default. If you are unsure how to do this, refer to a previous module. To begin, type the letter a in braille and then submit the text. To submit, use a two finger swipe up gesture. Note, the braille keyboard must be in the correct orientation for this gesture to work correctly.
Incorrect letter submitted. Try again.
Great job. You correctly typed in the letter A.
Now, try to type the word hello and submit using the same two finger swipe up gesture.
Great job. You correctly typed in the word hello. You have completed this module. Sending you back to the lesson screen.
Incorrect word submitted. Try again.
hello
repeat instructions

Welcome to the open braille keyboard settings tutorial, you can access the braille keyboard settings page by swiping up with three fingers when the braille keyboard is active. Use all your knowledge, change the braille language to Arabic and enter any Arabic character in the following text box, then close the keyboard by using 2 fingers to swipe down, you would have to select arabic as one of the language options by entering the settings page from the braille keyboard options. After completing this, return to this text box.
Congrats, you have managed to open the braille settings page and enter an Arabic character in the text box. Click the continue button when you are ready.
Continue

In this module you will learn how to close the braille keyboard when it is on the screen, this can be done by using 2 finger to swipe down while the braille keyboard is active, input the character \'a\' in the following text box and use the gesture to hide the keyboard. then return here.
Congrats, you have learnt to close the text box, use the continue button on this page to return to the lesson screen.
That was not the correct gesture, that was for submitting text, try it again using the correct gesture, which is two finger swipe down.

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open Talkback Menu. Talkback menu let you use commands to read, edit text, control speech output, change Talkback setting, and so on. To do this, use one finger to swipe up, or down then swipe right immediately.
Well done! You now know how to open and close Talkback Menu. Once again, to do this you have to swipe up, or down then swipe right. You have completed the lesson.
Great job. You have opened the Talkback menu. Feel free to navigate around to see what you can do. Once you are done, go to the bottom of the menu and exit.
